meanings.definition: A person or thing seen as comparable to another.
meanings.sent1: My friend is like an analogue of me, always wearing similar clothes.
meanings.sent2: The toy car was an analogue of the real sports car.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how my cat acts as an analogue of my mood, always napping when I'm tired.
meanings.sent4: The old tree can be seen as an analogue of wisdom, standing tall and strong.
meanings.sent5: The painting served as an analogue of the artist's emotions, vibrant and expressive.

meanings.definition: A chemical compound that resembles another in structure.
meanings.sent1: The artificial sweetener is an analogue of sugar, providing a similar taste.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying a new analogue of the drug to improve its effectiveness.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how the fake flower is an analogue of the real one, fooling many.
meanings.sent4: The new building is an analogue of the old one, sharing the same architectural style.
meanings.sent5: The designer created an analogue of the original dress, with a modern twist.
